slide.title: Complexity
slide.blurb: Often the complexity of the problems in analysis/design of structures grow at an exponential rate.

list.title: For example: (*)
list.bullet: Redesign of a small protein (about 80 residues): 10^115 combinations
Changing the (hydrophobic) core of a protein (170 core residues): 10^224 combinations
Side-chain placement on a protein backbone (2462 residues): 10^1044 combinations

slide.blurb: (*) From: Looger, L.L. and Hellinga, H.W. "Journal of Molecular Biology", 2001, 37, 429-445.
